Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Jar
Description: Ovoid jar with a greatly bulging body. The small, short and narrow neck ends in a vertical lip, 1,2 cm in height. A decorative pattern of three parallel wavy lines is impressed on the shoulder, as are parallel horizontal lines incised on the neck and below the conspicuous rope design at mid-level.
